title: How to Make Idli Gunpowder (Molagapodi)

steps.headline: Once all the above are roasted separately, keep them aside and let them cool for a couple of minutes.
In a mixer grinder, put all the roasted ingredients and add about a teaspoon of asafoetida and salt to taste and grind it all together.
Don't grind it too powdery, let the texture of the mixture be a little coarse.

text:
Roast the following ingredients in a pan one by one without oil.Chana Dal{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/98/Make-Idli-Gunpowder-%28Molagapodi%29-Step-1Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Make-Idli-Gunpowder-%28Molagapodi%29-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/98/Make-Idli-Gunpowder-%28Molagapodi%29-Step-1Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Make-Idli-Gunpowder-%28Molagapodi%29-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Dry Red Chilies{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5b/Make-Idli-Gunpowder-%28Molagapodi%29-Step-1Bullet2.jpg/v4-460px-Make-Idli-Gunpowder-%28Molagapodi%29-Step-1Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5b/Make-Idli-Gunpowder-%28Molagapodi%29-Step-1Bullet2.jpg/v4-760px-Make-Idli-Gunpowder-%28Molagapodi%29-Step-1Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Urdu Dal{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d0/Make-Idli-Gunpowder-%28Molagapodi%29-Step-1Bullet3.jpg/v4-460px-Make-Idli-Gunpowder-%28Molagapodi%29-Step-1Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d0/Make-Idli-Gunpowder-%28Molagapodi%29-Step-1Bullet3.jpg/v4-760px-Make-Idli-Gunpowder-%28Molagapodi%29-Step-1Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Peanuts{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ed/Make-Idli-Gunpowder-%28Molagapodi%29-Step-1Bullet4.jpg/v4-460px-Make-Idli-Gunpowder-%28Molagapodi%29-Step-1Bullet4.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ed/Make-Idli-Gunpowder-%28Molagapodi%29-Step-1Bullet4.jpg/v4-760px-Make-Idli-Gunpowder-%28Molagapodi%29-Step-1Bullet4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Sesame Seeds{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/22/Make-Idli-Gunpowder-%28Molagapodi%29-Step-1Bullet5.jpg/v4-460px-Make-Idli-Gunpowder-%28Molagapodi%29-Step-1Bullet5.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/22/Make-Idli-Gunpowder-%28Molagapodi%29-Step-1Bullet5.jpg/v4-760px-Make-Idli-Gunpowder-%28Molagapodi%29-Step-1Bullet5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Once all the above are roasted separately, keep them aside and let them cool for a couple of minutes. In a mixer grinder, put all the roasted ingredients and add about a teaspoon of asafoetida and salt to taste and grind it all together. Don't grind it too powdery, let the texture of the mixture be a little coarse.
